metadata/general_parameters.help: The general information of the measurements
metadata/general_parameters.label: General parameters
metadata/general_parameters/associated_p: If the data in this record is described in published literature (article, journal, thesis), information about the literature can be specified here
The full name of the journal the article appears in
Persistent identifier associated with the publication (e.g. DOI, ISBN, URN)
The full name of the publisher of the book
The type of degree (equivalent) the thesis was submitted to attain
metadata/general_parameters/chemical_env: Composition of the chemical environment (colloquially known as the buffer).

Additional information about the chemical environment can be specified here (e.g. prepared just prior to conducting the measurement, additional treatments like UV irradiation, specific storage container of chemical environment if that influenced the measurement etc.)
List of the constituents, excluding solvent components, that made up the chemical environment (i.e. buffer system, salts, surfactants, crowding agents, serum, etc.)
Additional information about the polymer can be specified here
Concentration of the constituent including its relative concentration related to the collected sample or absolute concentration of the constituent
The numerical value of the concentration, -1 if unknown
The biological species that was used to express (produce) the polymer. Note that this is based on the NCBI taxonomy
List of identifiers to records in external databases containing information about the polymer can be specified here (e.g uniprot:Q8KRF6)
If the polymer contains modifications such as non-natural aminoacids, post translational modification, or chemically modifications like labeling, it can be specified here
Modifications of the polymer made after synthesis (e.g. posttranslational modifications, DNA methylation) by the organism where synthesis occurred (e.g. glycosylation)
The position where the modification occurs
List of steps that led to the modification taking place
The common name/type of the modification
Modifications of the polymer introduced by chemical, biochemical, or physical means in vitro (e.g. lysine methylation, cysteine iodoacetamide labeling, deglycosylation, covalent fluorescent labeling)
The position where the modification occurs
List of steps that led to the modification taking place
The common name/type of the modification
Modifications (e.g. non-natural amino acids) of the polymer made during synthesis (e.g. translation) of the polymer
The position where the modification occurs
List of steps that led to the modification taking place
The common name/type of the modification
The molecular weight of the polymer
The unit of the molecular weight
The numerical value of the molecular weight, -1 if unknown
Short descriptive name (id) of the constituent, must be unique within a record (e.g. NaCl, Human serum P1, Lysozyme, etc.)
Information about if and how quality control of the polymer was performed
Information about if, and how homogeneity was assessed
Whether or not the homogeneity was checked
The number of species that were expected to be present
The method used to evaluate the homogeneity
The number of species that was observed to be present
Information about if, and how identity was assessed
How identity was determined by fingerprinting, if applicable
How identity was determined by intact mass, if applicable
The amount, including unit, the obtained intact mass deviated from the expected intact mass
The unit of the molecular weight
The numerical value of the molecular weight, -1 if unknown
The method used to determine the intact mass
How identity was determined by sequencing, if applicable
The amount of the total (expected) sequence that was actually observed by sequencing in percent
The method that was used for sequencing
Wether the identity was confirmed experimentally
Information about if, and how purity was assessed
Wether or not the purity was checked
The method that was used to determine the purity
Primary sequence of the polymer, using single letter codes (e.g. SAGRELLE, AGTTA). In case of non-natural amino acids or nucleotides, please place the monomer in brackets
The biological species where the polymer naturally occurs. Note that this is based on the NCBI taxonomy
The type of the constituent, options are Polymer, Chemical, and defined assembly

Descriptive name indicating differences of primary sequence of the polymer as compared to the most common form, or wildtype, including mutations, purification tags, etc. (A53T, C-terminal GFP, N-terminal 6xHis-tag)
Unique and persistent identifier from an external source; options of sources are CAS number, ChEMBL ID, Pubchem Compound ID, and Pubchem Substance ID

InChIKey identifier of the chemical. In case of chemical polymers please specify the InChIKey of the monomer and specify the specific type in the additional identifiers field (e.g. if PEG 3350 was employed, the InChiKey of ethylene glycol, i.e. LYCAIKOWRPUZTN-UHFFFAOYSA-N should be specified here)
If the isotopic composition of the chemical was altered from the naturally occurring abundances, it can be specified here (e.g. 15N, 13C)
List describing deliberate modifications made to the molecular assembly through chemical, biochemical, or physical means
The position where the modification occurs
List of steps that led to the modification taking place
The common name/type of the modification

Description of the individual components (e.g. polypeptide, heme, lipids, metal ions etc.) the molecular assembly is composed of (e.g. Hemoglobin alpha) and how many copies of each component were present

Number of copies of the component within the assembly, -1 if unknown

metadata/general_parameters/collection_s: The date when collection of the raw data began
metadata/general_parameters/depositors.h: Information about the depositors (authors) of this record
metadata/general_parameters/depositors/c: List of other people who contributed to generating the deposited data, metadata, results , or the deposition itself
The affiliation of the person. Note that this is based on the Research Organization Registry (ROR)
The given name(s), including middlename(s), of the person
Persistent personal identifiers, currently only ORCIDs are allowed
metadata/general_parameters/depositors/d: The person who made the deposition to MBDB
The affiliation of the person. Note that this is based on the Research Organization Registry (ROR)
The given name(s), including middlename(s), of the person
Persistent personal identifiers, currently only ORCIDs are allowed
metadata/general_parameters/depositors/p: The person responsible for the record and the one to contact for inquiries, would typically be the principle investigator group leader, or laboratory head
The affiliation of the person. Note that this is based on the Research Organization Registry (ROR)
The given name(s), including middlename(s), of the person
Persistent personal identifiers, currently only ORCIDs are allowed

The biological species where the polymer naturally occurs. Note that this is based on the NCBI taxonomy

The type of the entity, where the options are (biological) Polymer, Chemical, Molecular assembly (also includes all proteins composed of more than one polypeptide chain) or Complex substance. Chemical polymers such as PEG 5000 should be described as being a Chemical. Complex substance refers to substances which are not exactly specified by their exact chemical composition by the time measurement were performed, but e.g. blood, serum, plant extract

metadata/general_parameters/funding_refe: List of information about the grants that supported generation of the raw data annotated by this record. Note that this information is based on OpenAire Projects
metadata/general_parameters/instrument.h: Information about the instrument being used to collect (measure) the raw data annotated by this record
metadata/general_parameters/instrument/m: Name of the manufacturer of the instrument used for raw data collection
metadata/general_parameters/raw_measurem: List of file(s) containing the raw measurements
metadata/general_parameters/record_infor: Information about the record itself, including whether this particular record is associated with other records
Record information

The access rights to the uploaded files. There are three options, 1) "open access" where the files are accessible immediately when the deposition is published, 2) "embargoed access" where the files will only become available after a specified date, 3) "restricted access" where depositors are of the record are the only ones who has access
The date when the data was/will be made publicly available. Will be automatically generated
The date when the data was deposited; automatically generated
The external identifier of the record which is a DOI generated by Datacite. This will automatically be generated when the record is published

The access rights to the metadata. Minimal metadata that includes title and depositors is accessible regardless of which type is chosen as it is required to obtain a DOI. There are three options, 1) "open access" where the complete metadata are accessible immediately when the deposition is published, 2) "embargoed access" where the files will only become available after a specified date, 3) "restricted access" where depositors are of the record are the only ones who has access
When made available MBDB is to be considered the publisher, however, the depositors are still the owners
DataCite item which shows type of dataset the record is and corresponds directly to which kind of technique was used (MST/BLI/SPR)
All records are considered to be datasets
DataCite subject category the record data belongs to default is Biophysics
Short descriptive title of the record
metadata/general_parameters/results.help: List of the results (parameter) that were derived by analyzing the raw data, and which steps were taken to obtain them
metadata/general_parameters/results/enti: List of chemical or molecular assemblies the result describes and how many copies of each are involved
Number of copies of the entity that contribute to the result, -1 if unknown (e.g. if two individual copies of a polymer binds to another, the copy number would be 2)
Name (ids) of the entity (from the entities of interest defined in the general parameters)
metadata/general_parameters/results/name: Descriptive name (id) of the result (e.g. Kd of Lysozyme and VHH2). Must be unique within a record
metadata/general_parameters/results/type: The type of physical parameter the result represents
metadata/general_parameters/results/valu: The expected error of the result in terms of a 95 % confidence interval
True if the error values should be interpreted as relative errors (fractional uncertainty)

The lower error, i.e. the number that should be subtracted from the value to get the lower bound of the 95 % confidence interval. The same unit as the value being described is assumed. If relative errors are provided, please provide it in fractional form (e.g.  0.01 for 1 %)

The upper error, i.e. the number that should be added to the value to get the upper bound of the 95 % confidence interval. The same unit as the value being described is assumed. If relative errors are provided, please provide it in fractional form (e.g.  0.01 for 1 %)
metadata/general_parameters/schema_versi: The schema version used to annotate the general parameters of the record
metadata/general_parameters/technique.he: The type of experimental technique used for collecting the raw data annotated by this record
metadata/method_specific_parameters.help: The parameters of the experiment that is specific to BLI
metadata/method_specific_parameters/data: The details of how data analysis was performed to obtain results
The details of how data fitting of the data to obtain the result was performed
Numerical value representing the quality estimate of the result
The name of the software that was used for doing the data fitting (e.g. Excel)
The version of the software that was used for the step
Describe the steps in the data analysis prior to fitting (removing outliers in the raw data, applying data filter, placing data at same start time etc. )
Description of what the processing step was
If processing was performed with software where the source code is freely available a link can be specified here (e.g. self-written python script in a GitHub repository
Short descriptive name of the processing step
The name of the software that was used for the step (e.g. Excel)
The version of the software that was used for the step
If the data was analyzed with time windows corresponding to fluorescence before and after an IR laser was heating the sample the edges of the time windows can be specified here
Numerical value of the end-point of time interval used to establish the initial fluorescence, F_cold
Numerical value of the start-point of time interval used to establish the initial fluorescence, F_cold
Numerical value of the end-point of time interval used to establish the fluorescence temperature induced change in fluorescence, F_hot
Numerical value of the start-point of time interval used to establish the fluorescence temperature induced change in fluorescence, F_hot
The unit of time used for reporting measurement data
List of measurement links that was analyzed together
metadata/method_specific_parameters/meas: Unique ID to be used as a link target

Name (id) of the measurement which must be unique within a record (i.e. triplicates must be named individually in the raw data file). The name must allow location of the measurement data within the raw data file as well as processed data files if these are present
metadata/method_specific_parameters/data: Link to the result(s) that was obtained by the data analysis. The link is to the results defined in the general parameters
metadata/method_specific_parameters/exci: The color of the excitation LED used for the experiment. NOTE that colors are specific to the combination in which it occurs, e.g. the GREEN in a BLUE/GREEN instrument, is not the same as the GREEN in a GREEN/RED instrument
The power, in percentage, of the excitation LED used in experiment
metadata/method_specific_parameters/expe: Which type of parameter is sought with the measurements
metadata/method_specific_parameters/ir_m: The power of the infrared LASER used in the experiment in percentages. Even though a change in nomenclature occurred in Nanotemper's control software, the underlying data is still stored in percentages. Use the following conversion; Low = 20, Medium = 40, High = 60
metadata/method_specific_parameters/meas: List of measurement where each step from each sensor is considered a single measurement
Position where the container (capillary) of the measured sample within the instrument (e.g. 1, 2, 3)
Sample the sensor was in contact with during the measurement
Name (id) of the chemical environment of the sample (from the chemical environments defined in the general parameters)
List of names (ids) of entities (from the entities of interest defined in the general parameters) that were used to alter the behavior of the target(s)
The numerical value of the concentration, -1 if unknown
Name (id) of the entity (from the entities of interest defined in the general parameters)
The container the sample was in during the measurement
List of steps taken to prepare the sample
List of names (ids), from the entities of interest defined in the general parameters, of directly measured entities
The numerical value of the concentration, -1 if unknown
Name (id) of the entity (from the entities of interest defined in the general parameters)
metadata/method_specific_parameters/sche: The schema version used to annotate the BLI method specific parameters
metadata/method_specific_parameters/sign: The type of signal that was being measured
metadata/method_specific_parameters/temp: The temperature of the sample chamber while the measurement was performed
The numeric value of the temperature
metadata/general_parameters/instrument/n: The name of the instrument as provided by the manufacturer
metadata/method_specific_parameters/meas: Information about each of the positions where data was collected including reference positions
The flow cell where the measurement spot is located
id to be used as a link target
Information about the ligand and how it was immobilized
The type of chemistry on ligands and surface that allows for immobilization of the ligands on the surface of the senor
List of steps for immobilizing the ligand on the surface of the sensor
Position of the measurement spot within the flow cell
List of the steps in the measurement protocol
Information about the liquid flow during the measurement step

list of the flow-path, in terms of measurement positions. Measurement positions that are connected by a flow running serially through them should be mentioned within the inner list, while parallel flows should be mentioned in the outer list
id to be used for internal links
Descriptive name (id) of the a step in the measurement protocol which must be unique within a record
The numerical value of the start point of the measurement step relative to the beginning of the measurement in the units defined in the general parameters
The unit of the time duration
The numerical value of the time point or duration
The numerical value of the total time of the measurement step took in the units defined in the general parameters
The unit of the time duration
The numerical value of the time point or duration
Which type of step in the measurement protocol this refers to
List of samples that went across the reference measurement position during data collection

List of names (ids) of entities (from the entities of interest defined in the general parameters) that was used to alter the behavior of the target(s) or entities present at varying concentrations for a series of measurements
The numerical value of the concentration, -1 if unknown
Name (id) of the entity (from the entities of interest defined in the general parameters)
Name (id) of the chemical environment of the sample (from the chemical environments defined in the general parameters)
Name (id) of the measurement step in the measurement protocol where the sample was measured
Position of the sample within the sample holder
List of steps taken to prepare the sample
Temperature of the sample while being measured
The numeric value of the temperature
List of samples that went across a measurement position during data collection

List of names (ids) of entities (from the entities of interest defined in the general parameters) that was used to alter the behavior of the target(s) or entities present at varying concentrations for a series of measurements
The numerical value of the concentration, -1 if unknown
Name (id) of the entity (from the entities of interest defined in the general parameters)

Whether or not the sensor was used in previous measurements
How the initialization of the sensor was performed

metadata/method_specific_parameters/meas: The numerical value of the shaking speed of the plate during the measurement step in the units defined in the general parameters
The unit of the shaking/stirring speed)
The numerical value of the shaking/stirring speed
The reported error of the value of the shaking speed (e.g. standard deviation, % error)
True if the error values should be interpreted as relative errors (fractional uncertainty)

The lower error, i.e. the number that should be added to the value to get the upper bound of the 95 % confidence interval. The same unit as the value being described is assumed. If relative errors are provided, please provide it in fractional form (e.g.  0.01 for 1 %)

The upper error, i.e. the number that should be added to the value to get the upper bound of the 95 % confidence interval. The same unit as the value being described is assumed. If relative errors are provided, please provide it in fractional form (e.g.  0.01 for 1 %)
link to one of the measurement steps
